N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 542.7 - Safety standards for securing firearms and ammunition

State Regulations
(a) Individuals who are authorized by the
commissioner or his or her designee or facility director to possess firearms on
the grounds of a facility shall meet all safety standards described in this
section. (1)

All firearms and ammunition
possessed by employees living on the grounds of a State-operated facility shall
be stored only in the employee's room or home. (2)

All firearms and ammunition possessed in
family care homes shall be stored in a section of the home which is not
ordinarily accessible to residents. (3)

All firearms and ammunition in family
care homes shall be stored in separate double-locked cabinets which are in
separate locations. Under no circumstances shall firearms and ammunition be
stored in the same cabinet. (4)

Keys to storage cabinets in family care homes shall not be accessible to
residents. (5)

All firearms which
are part of a gun collection shall be rendered inoperable by removal of the
firing mechanism. (b) The facility safety officer shall inspect all firearms, ammunition and storage
arrangements in family care homes at least twice each calendar year. Notes
